head.supplied: 27/2/93 ¶ ¶ May I mention to you, dear Dr Bride, that the first Decade of the "Iconography of Candolleaceous plants" ¶ has lately appeared at the Gov. Printing Office, so that you can obtain your 25...

div.p: VPRS 805/P000O/170/93-251, inward and outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

May I mention to you, dear Dr Bride, that the first Decade of the "Iconography of Candolleaceous plants"
B93.02.04. has lately appeared at the Gov. Printing Office, so that you can obtain your 25 copies by applying in the usual course.
On 3 March 1893, T. Bride minuted: 'Say the[y] will at once be applied for and thank'. A reply was sent to M on 6 March; letter not found. On the same day the Library's junior assistant, Patrick Quirk, was instructed to apply for 25 copies; he noted on the file that 25 copies had been received on 21 October 1892, but this must refer to another publication.
I intended for some time to call on you, but have been so overwhelmed with work in the Department, that I found it impossible to pay any visits. Still, I keep you always in friendly remembrance.
